plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I've been fan of Copilot for years, but now it's become unusable and I'm cancelling subscription as I can't see improvement for years. Too buggy, to slow, slopy suggestions (better not to suggest at all). Sorry, but caused issues for so long and broke projects several times, so it deserves lowest score.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Far too buggy. The text truncating issue has come back in the most recent release. Do better Microslop.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: This plugin is completely broken. The text in the chat jumps around while scrolling, it generates way too many .md files, even for simple answers, it shows 'rate limit' errors despite having plenty of tokens left, chat sometimes resets after I send a prompt, causing my prompt to disappear. I‚Äôve switched to VS Code for AI programming.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Hitting constant rate limits on opus models, even with a pro plan. Pretty much useless for anything even slightly more complex than quick code completion

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Everything is broken with this plugin; every next update they make it worse - as of now the response generate by it have incomplete code snippets

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: As of today, Github Copilot only displays suggestions that are interrupted in the middle of the code. The tool is no longer usable.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The quality of this product is shameful, especially when you compare it to what is available on other IDEs. Every usage is basically a coin toss, it may work perfectly or it may give you a random problem (random responses filtered out, incomplete responses, not enough token problems when you've got plenty, etc.)

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Although good when it works, the unpredictable behavior breaks usability completely. Rate limiting while still having plenty of tokens left interrupts context and produces unstable or completely broken code. Context retainment even in an agent session is dubious, and instructions need to be reiterated multiple times.

But most annoying at all? Agent mode can happily produce 3-4 .md files summarizing and explaining code changes for the simplest of tasks.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I never have big complained about this plugin, I'm usually using just ask question and ignore other feature, but every new update it keeps breaking stuff and feel worse somehow, and now with the newest update which I regrade upgrade, cut off the answer before the reply is full complete

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
Overall, it provides a great experience. I get especially impressive results with the Sonnet and Opus models. Recently, I also integrated my database via MCP, which helped complete my development ecosystem. Kudos to the IntelliJ developers for their great work.

There are occasional rate-limit issues, but I use GitHub Copilot across multiple editors and see the same limitation elsewhere as well. I‚Äôm confident this will be resolved in the near future. I will continue using GitHub Copilot with IntelliJ.

comment: Unfortunately Copilot has become unusable for me. I‚Äôm constantly hitting rate limits; roughly every 1‚Äì2 prompts even on a Pro plan. At this point I‚Äôm forced to stop using Copilot and pay for another tool, because a paid product that rate-limits after the first couple of prompts isn‚Äôt reliable for daily development.

comment: GitHub Copilot's sign-in feature isn't working properly on Windows 11 ARM, and the chat page just keeps spinning/loading forever. I've tried it on both IntelliJ IDEA 2023 and IDEA 2025 (ARM versions), and both have the same issues.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The edit mode stopped working. When I request to edit some code via chat, there is no response, and sometimes a change appears in the code out of nowhere, without any interaction with the copilot.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: 2 days ago I found out that moving selected code in RIder, simply removes it. Pasting to AI Assistant input box doesn't work via Ctrl+V or context menu. Updated GitHub Copilot, Restarted IDE, Reset cache... Restarted computer. Today fixed by disabling GitHub Copilot.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
While AI isn't "totally there yet", this is certainly good at integrating with Rider and giving the models context to your project. I especially like that I can make a copilot-instructions file to give it some global context.

As far as models it supports quite a bit, including Opus 4.5 which has been the best for my Unreal Engine development as far as making complex systems. Like I said still a bit aways away from truly having the context length required to be a full helper, but I am grading off what it is now and not what it could be in the future.

Only question I have is: Opus 4.6 when?

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Continuously improving integration and regular updates. Major leap forward over the past few months.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I love it, it was buggy a few months ago now it works very well. I can't work without it now.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: It works sometimes, that is good

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I love the Rider IDE, but it's almost impossible to use GitHub Copilot there. It has some annoying bugs, and the most annoying is about MCP Servers. The chat does not recognize my local running MCPs and mcp.json frequently disappears with labels to start and stop the servers.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Frequently hits some error about rate limits even after few minutes of usage. IDE sometimes completely freezes when using this plugin, so I have to manually kill process and restart IDE. CPU usage randomly spikes when using this plugin. Pop ups about code are not hiding when switching to another window, often stays on my screen forever until I'll go back to IDE and remove them here. Overall - not really usable, causes more problems than real help.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I've been using GitHub Copilot in IntelliJ since June 2025. Despite early bugs (performance lags, high memory/CPU usage, slow linting), it's evolving positively with recent updates improving stability, chat UI, and features like code review and extensions. It performs well across small, medium, and large Java/JavaScript projects, solid inline suggestions and chat help speed up coding. I'm especially happy with the repository-specific context document feature. I'm disappointed that many premium models remain locked behind higher tiers instead of being included, but I'm happy with the ones already provided. Competitors like Cursor offer stronger project-wide context in some cases, so GitHub should keep pushing quality to match its popularity. Overall, it's a strong, improving tool worth using.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: It‚Äôs getting worse with every update. Bugs remain unfixed for a long time. The most annoying issue is when the entire chat disappears.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: First query today, about 20 lines of project requirements to build a browser extension. Plan mode with Claude Opus 4.5 refuses to work saying "ooops" I have reached my token limit. Sorry, but this is just as bad as JetBrains' AI assistant, only that it spies on our customers' data while still not producing helpful code even in the paid plan version.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The difference between the VS Code and Android Studio plugins is huge. If I leave the model on automatic, it chooses Sonnet and uses up all my credits because when I send the prompt, it keeps calculating and doesn't return or do anything, besides all the unnecessary hallucinations. It doesn't remember my prompts and invents things. I'm wasting a lot of money on this and I don't even get any compensation for it. I'm very disappointed. And I'm still trying to use some OpenIA model (having the ApiKey) and I only get error messages or messages saying that I've reached the limit.

It authenticates successfully in the browser but nothing happens in the IDE.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Latest version does not work with GitHUB Enterprise products, authentication fails because it mixes github and ghe addresses. The configured server-name is not used. Bugs are opened and a reference to last years version is recommended, but it won't work since last years version is no longer API compatible and cannot be installed. Will review if fixed...

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: I dont get all the negative reviews. Ok, sure It's not perfect yet, but it keeps improving steadily, and the last week I have been using it without issues, the agent mode is now really good and stable and helping me increase my productivity by a factor of 2-3. To the developers: Don't be discouraged, keep up the good work!

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: The basic functionality is there, so it warrants 1 or 2 stars, but this plugin is sadly so far behind in terms of stability and usability and has too many bugs when compared to plugins in other IDEs that this might be finally the reason to switch over from CLion to VS Code. Editing your prompt often gets it deleted by pressing Ctrl-Shift-Left to select the current line but selects the whole text, scrolling up in the first line brings back the previous prompt with no way to get back to the one you currently type, Agents defined in the appropriate .md files don't show up, local MCP servers do not work AT ALL (for WEEKS! now without fix) -- you can define them, but no tools are discovered and they cannot be used.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment:
If I compare the planning mode in VSCode and Webstorm, for some reason Webstorm immediately displays a sample code it's implementing, even though planning mode isn't designed to display code.

Often, during planning mode, the AI ‚Äã‚Äãwill say something like "I don't have access to editing tools" and start dumbly outputting the implementation as text instead of creating a plan.

It's also annoying that when I press Shift + CMD + Left, instead of selecting a line (like in VSCode or any other text window), it selects the entire text. This is incredibly inconvenient when you want to edit a single line of a prompt, not the entire prompt. This wasn't the case in earlier versions of the plugin.

plugin.name: GitHub Copilot - Your AI Pair Programmer

comment: Awful experience, which is worsening every update. It doesn't worth it, even if it was for free.
